result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Cesar Garcia Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance is to be paid  directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Cesar Garcia Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:37 PM: Defendant Mario Cesar Garcia Martinez in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at prior proceeding today.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he is leaving for Mexico in approx 19 days.  Off Record for Def to speak directly with State on resolution.  Back of Record at 3:40 PM: Resolution recited by ADA - State recommend Court Costs only as penalty.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Knowing and Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  Cannot come back for another hearing - Otherwise None offered.  The Court:  Accepts State's recommendation and imposes Court Costs only - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Samply to be provided today.  Procedure for expungement of DNA Record thru DOJ explained.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.

citations.chargeDescr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)
